intro: Viola suavis, commonly known as the sweet violet, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers, which bloom in spring, range in color from purple to white and are often used in perfumes and traditional medicine. Viola suavis is also a popular ornamental plant in gardens due to its aesthetic appeal and hardy nature.
